result.execSummary:
The defendant Damen R. Thompson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Damen R. Thompson in court with attorney John Miller Carroll.  Atty. Danuta E. Kurczewski in court for the District Attorney's office.  Atty. Amanda R. Rabe in court on behalf of the victim.  Devin R.S sworn and testified.  Exhibit #1 - letter from Therapist - marked and recv'd (Atty. Rabe).  Exhibit #2 - letter from Therapist - marked and recv'd (Atty. Rabe).  Exhibit #3 - calculations regarding expenses - marked and recv'd (Atty. Rabe).  Atty. Rabe requests that the Court recieve the exhibits and also requests that the exhibits #1&2 be sealed.  Objection by Atty. Carroll regarding recieving exhibit #1 & 2.  Stmt. by Atty. Rabe.  Stmt. by Atty. Carroll.  Court recieves the exhibits #1, 2 and 3; and orders exhibits #1&2 to be sealed.  Closing arguments by Atty. Rabe and Atty. Carroll.  Stmt. by the Court.  Court will hold this matter open at this time and orders that the Defendant D. Thompson pay $200.00 per month commencing June 1st to be held in trust by the Clerk of Courts office and paid out at the end of each year upon documentation that supports the claims filed by the victims family and prior to payment regardaing the claims the defendant may request a hearing.  Court orders that the Judgment of Conviction be amended to reflect the $200.00 per month payment commencing June 1, 2018 to be held in trust.  Stmt. by Atty. Carroll.  Court also orders that the $1,091.00 that is the balance from the bond be held in trust and applied towards advanced restitution in the trust account by the Clerk of Courts office.  Order to be prepared by Atty. Rabe.  Atty. Rabe to go to the Clerk of Courts office today to provide a redacted copy of exhibit #1 & 2 for purposes of the information within those exhibits.
